subject: Philosophy
title: The Libet Experiment
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Libet Experiment.

hook.text: In 1983, Benjamin Libet wired people's brains and asked them to move their wrist freely.

buildup.text: Brain activity spiked hundreds of milliseconds before people reported deciding to move.

discovery.text: The brain seemed to 'decide' before the person was conscious of choosing.

twist.text: Critics argue the experiment only measures when awareness surfaces, not when choice begins.

climax.text: Decades later, the debate rages. No experiment has settled the free will question.

quiz.question: What did Libet's experiment suggest?
options: Brain activity precedes conscious awareness of a decision
